definition: in hand/(a situation is) in sb's hands
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
straight or circular throwing-knife used by ninja and samurai (loanword from Japanese 手裏剣 shuriken)

sentences.english: They are wanted in the farm much oftener than I can get them.
sentences.chinese: 农庄是要用马，但是到我手里的时候并不多啊。

sentences.english: Opening my eyes, I saw a big boy glaring at me, a white washcloth in hand.
sentences.chinese: 睁开眼，一个大男孩望着我，手里拿条白色毛巾。

sentences.english: Lester ruminated for a while, toying with his fork.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脱手里拿一把叉玩弄着沉吟了半晌。

sentences.english: Right now you're holding a parachute from a German flare in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 现在你手里拿的是一个德国照明弹上的降落伞。

sentences.english: If I have a wad of cash, I find myself going through it quickly.
sentences.chinese: 若我手里现在一卷现金，我会将它一扫而空。

sentences.english: His face was drained of color, and he carried a strange, strong-smelling rag in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他面无血色，手里拿着一块怪味浓重的布头。

sentences.english: She dispenses shampoo into her hands and massages it into my head.
sentences.chinese: 她将洗头液在手里按揉并涂抹到我的头上。

sentences.english: Not long after, a guard came in, waving a blindfold.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，一个看守进来，手里挥舞着蒙眼用的布条。

sentences.english: She wrested it from his hands.
sentences.chinese: 她硬把它从他手里夺去。

sentences.english: Large concentrations of capital were in the hands of merchants.
sentences.chinese: 大量资本集中在商人手里。

sentences.english: The bold folk fold up the gold or hold it in hor.
sentences.chinese: 大胆的大部份人将金子折叠起来拿在手里。

sentences.english: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
sentences.chinese: 以法莲是商人，手里有诡诈的天平，爱行欺骗。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and via his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睁开眼睛，透过泪水看向他依然捏在手里的绳圈。

sentences.english: People are scared and the only thing they're doing is selling.
sentences.chinese: 人们很害怕，他们唯一可以做的就是抛掉手里的股票。

sentences.english: "What's in my hands?" asked the little boy.
sentences.chinese: “我手里是什么工具？”阿谁小男孩问道。

sentences.english: "Mr. Silver, sir?" I asked, holding out the note.
sentences.chinese: “阁下是西尔弗先生吗？”我问，手里攥着纸条。

definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
a skill/mastery of a trade/by oneself/without outside help
there/that place/also written 那裡|那里
to take possession of/to get hold of
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to fish out/to take out (from a pocket, bag etc)
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
